title: Mainoo one of three England players to pull out of Nations League squad
description: England have been dealt a triple injury blow before their Nations League matches, with Kobbie Mainoo, Morgan Gibbs-White and Ezri Konsa pulling out of the squad. title: Quansah signs new long-term Liverpool deal
description: Jarell Quansah has signed a long-term contract at Liverpool. The defender has been at the club since the age of five and enjoyed an impressive breakout season under Jurgen Klopp last season. title: ´It was not good´ – Bompastor frustrated with decision to postpone Man Utd match

title: Kane fit to play for England in Nations League
description: Bayern Munich confirmed Harry Kane did not suffer a serious injury against Eintracht Frankfurt and will be available for England in the international break. description: Pep Guardiola admitted that Ederson came close to leaving Manchester City in the transfer window but stayed because a fee could not be agreed. title: Netherlands legend Neeskens dies aged 73
description: Netherlands and Ajax legend Johan Neeskens has passed away at the age of 73, the Royal Dutch Football Association (KNVB) has announced. Neeskens played a key role in the Ajax and Netherlands teams credited with popularising “total football” in the 1970s, playing alongside Johan Cruyff for club and country. title: Injury forces Militao out of Brazil´s World Cup qualifiers
description: Eder Militao will miss Brazil’s upcoming World Cup qualifiers against Chile and Peru due to a thigh injury. title: Barcelona and Spain forward Torres suffers hamstring injury
description: Barcelona and Spain forward Ferran Torres has suffered a hamstring injury and will be out of action for an indefinite period, the Catalan giants said on Monday. The 24-year-old will miss Spain’s Nations League matches against Denmark on Saturday and Serbia next Tuesday, having damaged the biceps femoris muscle in his right thigh.
